intro: Nicotiana pandurata, commonly known as the horned tobacco or horned nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are broad and hairy, often with a distinct waxy coating. Nicotiana pandurata is part of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes.
